greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of standard Young tableaux of n cells and height <= k; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
comment: Also the number A(n,k) of standard Young tableaux of n cells and <= k columns.

A(n,k) is also the number of n-length words w over a k-ary alphabet {a1,a2,...,ak} such that for every prefix z of w we have #(z,a1) >= #(z,a2) >= ... >= #(z,ak), where #(z,x) counts the letters x in word z.  The A(4,4) = 10 words of length 4 over alphabet {a,b,c,d} are: aaaa, aaab, aaba, abaa, aabb, abab, aabc, abac, abca, abcd.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..80, flattened
formula: Conjecture: A(n,k) ~ k^n/Pi^(k/2) * (k/n)^(k*(k-1)/4) * prod(j=1..k,Gamma(j/2)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Sep 12 2013
example: A(4,2) = 6, there are 6 standard Young tableaux of 4 cells and height <= 2:
maple: h:= proc(l) local n; n:=nops(l); add(i, i=l)! /mul(mul(1+l[i]-j
g:= proc(n, i, l) option remember;
mathematica: h[l_List] := Module[{n = Length[l]}, Sum[i, {i, l}]!/Product[Product[1 + l[[i]] - j + Sum [If[l[[k]] >= j, 1, 0], {k, i+1, n}], {j, 1, l[[i]]}], {i, 1, n}]]; g[n_, i_, l_List] := g[n, i, l] = If[n == 0, h[l], If[i < 1, 0, If[i == 1, h[Join[l, Array[1&, n]]], g [n, i-1, l] + If[i > n, 0, g[n-i, i, Append[l, i]]]]]]; a[n_, k_] := g[n, k, {}]; Table[Table[a[n, d-n], {n, 0, d}], {d, 0, 15}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 06 2013, translated from Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Apr 16 2012
